items.title: OII | Beyond Safety: The Digital Environment We Owe Children

items.title: The Download: introducing the 10 climate tech companies to watch for 2025
items.content_text: Plus: ICE is planning a social media surveillance team

items.title: 2025 Climate Tech Companies to Watch
items.content_text: MIT Technology Review's annual list of companies that are taking meaningful steps to reduce emissions and mitigate the impacts of climate change.

items.title: Bill Gates: Our best weapon against climate change is ingenuity
items.content_text: A measure I call the Green Premium reveals where we can invest in climate progress for maximum impact.

items.title: 2025 Climate Tech Companies to Watch: HiNa Battery Technology and its effort to commercialize salt cells
items.content_text: The Chinese startup has begun mass-producing two types of sodium-ion batteries and plans to launch a third this month.

items.title: How we picked promising climate tech companies in an especially unsettling year
items.content_text: And what distinguishes the firms that made the 2025 edition of our annual list of Climate Tech Companies to Watch.

items.title: 2025 Climate Tech Companies to Watch: Pairwise and its climate-adapted crops
items.content_text: The company is gene editing crops to make our food supply more resilient to climate change.

items.title: 2025 Climate Tech Companies to Watch: Cemvision and its low-emissions cement
items.content_text: The startup is using waste materials and alternative fuels to make cement, slashing greenhouse gas emissions in a polluting industry.

items.title: 2025 Climate Tech Companies to Watch: Traton and its electric trucks
items.content_text: The company is boosting production to meet rising demand for its zero-emission rigs.

items.title: 2025 Climate Tech Companies to Watch: Ather Energy and its premium e-scooters
items.content_text: A few EV makers in India went belly up after the government abruptly scaled back incentives and cracked down on the misuse of subsidies. Ather survived the storm and sales are increasing.

items.title: 2025 Climate Tech Companies to Watch: Cyclic Materials and its rare earth recycling tech
items.content_text: The startup is poised to become a global leader in recycling rare earth magnets from old EVs, wind turbines, and more.

items.title: Global Resources Outlook 2024
items.content_text: The world is in the midst of a triple planetary crisis of climate change, biodiversity loss and pollution and waste. The global economy is consuming ever more natural resources, while the world is not on track to meet the Sustainable Development Goals.
